name: Symmetric Tree
title: Symmetric Tree
content:
Given the root of a binary tree, check whether it is a mirror of itself (i.e., symmetric around its center).

 

Example 1:

Input: root = [1,2,2,3,4,4,3]
Output: true

Example 2:

Input: root = [1,2,2,null,3,null,3]
Output: false

 

Constraints:

  • The number of nodes in the tree is in the range [1, 1000].
  • -100 <= Node.val <= 100

 

Follow up: Could you solve it both recursively and iteratively?

discussion_posts.name: AasheeshLikePanner
discussion_posts.content: I think this question difficulty is needed to be increased. Its difficulty should be medium.

discussion_posts.name: sharabiania
discussion_posts.content: Should change the title of the question to Mirror Tree. Symetric Tree can cause confusion.

discussion_posts.name: CodeDEVotion
discussion_posts.content: If you want to do this question in seconds, first solve Leetcode quesestions [Invert Tree](https://leetcode.com/problems/invert-binary-tree/description/) and [Same tree](https://leetcode.com/problems/same-tree/).\nTrust me you will do it easily after considering this question as a combo of two.

discussion_posts.name: mandy1339
discussion_posts.content: The solution was not trivial. You have to know how to traverse to trees simultaneously in inverse order. I couldn\'t think of any trivial solutions. Took me too long for an easy problem. What do you think?

discussion_posts.name: Paco98
discussion_posts.content: I tried to solve it using BFS and splitting it into levels, then checking if each level was a palindrome. I feel that is a more intuitive solution than traversing both halves at the same time. I got it to work for 197 out of 199 of cases before giving up.

discussion_posts.name: meow_power
discussion_posts.content: It\'s a shame that even on solving this problem before I can\'t think on how to solve this problem :(

discussion_posts.name: dark
discussion_posts.content:
This problem involves two point:

**symmetric:**

consider tree T:

if T is null, then T is symmetric

if T->left is mirror of T->right,then T is symmetric

**mirror**

consider two tree T and R:

if T=R=NULL, then T is mirror of R

if T and R both not NULL,and T->left is mirror of R->right,and T->right is mirror of R->left,then T and R is mirror

otherwise the mirror relationship cannot estabished

discussion_posts.name: kushalnagwanshicloud
discussion_posts.content: just move inorder in the leftsubtree and move reverse inorder in the rightsubtree simultaneously and check if they have the same value.
